case_vignette: A 45-YEAR-OLD WOMAN PRESENTS WITH ENLARGING BLOOD VESSELS ON HER TONGUE THAT RECENTLY HAVE INCREASED IN SIZE AND NUMBER. NUMEROUS 1- TO 2-MM DISCRETE RED MACULES AND PAPULES ARE SEEN ON HER TONGUE, ORAL MUCOSA, NOSE, LOWER LIP, AND FINGERTIPS. SHE HAS HAD FREQUENT NOSEBLEEDS SINCE CHILDHOOD AS WELL AS IRON-DEFICIENCY ANEMIA THAT HAS NOT RESPONDED TO IRON SUPPLEMENTATION. HER FATHER, WHO DIED AT THE AGE OF 50, HAD SIMILAR SYMPTOMS.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have enlarging blood vessels on my tongue, red spots, and bumps on my tongue, inside my mouth, nose, lower lip, and fingertips. Also, I've been having frequent nosebleeds since childhood.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any chronic illnesses or conditions?
Yes, I have iron-deficiency anemia that hasn't improved with iron supplementation.
Is there a family history of similar symptoms or any genetic disorders?
Yes, my father had similar symptoms and he passed away at the age of 50.
Final Diagnosis: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT)
